Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label different parts of the fish, such as fins, tail, and body.
The student can illustrate and label the habitat where the fish lives, such as a lake, river, or ocean.
The student can show and label the resources the fish needs, like water, to demonstrate how it survives in its habitat.
The student can depict and describe how the fish's environment provides what it needs, like water to swim in.
The student can include other living things that share the fish's habitat and show their interactions.
The student can identify and label any non-living elements, such as rocks or plants, that are part of the fish's ecosystem.
The student can show how the fish and its habitat are part of a larger system where everything works together.
